meta.title: Spring Lake Park Schools

meta.name: description
meta.content: Spring Lake Park Schools is a vibrant school community serving about 5,800 students from the suburbs of Blaine, Fridley and Spring Lake Park, in the northern Minneapolis-St. Paul metropolitan area. Our district purpose – “High expectations, high achievement for all. No excuses” – provides our focus to meet the unique and varied needs of each student.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Spring Lake Park Schools, schools in Blaine, schools in Blaine MN, schools in Fridley, schools in Fridley MN, schools in Spring Lake Park, best school in Blaine,

Spring Lake Park Schools is a vibrant school community serving about 5,800 students from the suburbs of Blaine, Fridley and Spring Lake Park, in the northern Minneapolis-St. Paul metropolitan area. Our district purpose – “High expectations, high achievement for all. No excuses” – provides our focus to meet the unique and varied needs of each student.

img.alt: Two students working together on a lego project

div.p:
High expectations.
High achievement for all.
No excuses.
Welcome to Spring Lake Park Schools! We are a vibrant school community serving about 6,100 students from suburbs in the northern Minneapolis-St. Paul metropolitan area.
Each student in Spring Lake Park Schools is known by name, strength, interest and need, leading to personalized student work and learning experiences!

We continue to expand our STEM learning for each student in Spring Lake Park Schools. We are redesigning traditional learning experiences and transforming our classrooms to help our students become creators, designers, inventors, thinkers and leaders.

Our vision to have every student prepared for college is bold and aspirational. We are collectively committed to designing engaging learning experiences that lead to each student earning 12 college credits by the end of 12th grade.

We are creating a system that encourages teacher creativity and doing things differently. Teachers use our 3D Design model to design learning experiences that are meaningful, engaging and enhance student success.

p.a: Learn More About Innovation and Design

div.p: The school board and district administration have an ongoing commitment of effective management of fiscal resources, which has positioned the district well for the future.

We continue to prioritize investing in teaching and specialist positions to maintain low class sizes. Our class sizes at all grade levels are among the lowest in the metro area and among neighboring districts.
As part of our Strategic Plan for the Future, we developed a set of core values to describe how we will work with our learners and each other.

p.a: Learn More About Our Strategic Plan

div.p: Hear from our staff, students and community about the amazing things that are happening in Spring Lake Park Schools every day.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailFull fsItemCount_5

div.p: STEM teacher, Westwood

Spring Lake Park is known for its innovation and student centered focus. I want to challenge my students to look outside the box and rely on their own skills, imagination and problem solving skills to create solutions to the problems set before them.

article.a: Read More about Jason Gable (opens in new window/tab)

div.title: Woodcrest kindergarten teacher Lina Mraz helping a student with his school work

img.alt: Woodcrest kindergarten teacher Lina Mraz helping a student with his school work

div.p: Kindergarten teacher, Woodcrest
I am #SLPPantherProud because the Spring Lake Park School community works extremely hard and is very committed to creating the best learning experience for all of our students.

article.a: Read More about Lina Mraz (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Teacher, Centerview

The best part of my day is when the doors open in the morning and students come running in! It's great to see that kids are so excited to be here each day and that they want to get to their class as quick as they can!
SLPHS Class of 2019

I am leaving SLP having learned much about literature, advanced math and sciences and the world, and most importantly, that no matter people's perceived differences, we all benefit when we join our resources to help one another.

article.a: Read More about Joe Privratsky (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Parent
This entire district is full of the best community, doing all of their work around what is best for kids.

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailFull fsItemCount_5

div.title: Two students holding up Extended Flexible Learning Signs in English and Spanish and smiling

img.alt: Two students holding up Extended Flexible Learning Signs in English and Spanish and smiling

div.a: Learning our way through a pandemic

div.p: As Minnesota reported its first case of COVID-19 on March 6, we were headed into spring break. Since then, we’ve learned a lot about resilience, flexibility, creativity and the extraordinary things we can accomplish as Spring Lake Park Schools. As we look ahead to finishing the year in extended flexible learning, we will embrace this as an opportunity with optimism and confidence despite the sadness of not being together.

article.a: Continue Reading about Learning our way through a pandemic

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-3 fsTag-9 fsTag-15 fsTag-113

div.title: Class of 2020 senior Francisca Dogbe smiling outside

img.alt: Class of 2020 senior Francisca Dogbe smiling outside

div.p: "I am SLP Panther Proud because SLP has given me many opportunities to explore the things that I wanted to learn more about as well as has provided a caring and progressive environment for me to learn in."

article.a: Continue Reading about Class of 2020 - Francisca Dogbe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-3 fsTag-9 fsTag-15 fsTag-113

div.title: Class of 2020 student Simon Tewalt smiling

img.alt: Class of 2020 student Simon Tewalt smiling

div.p: "I am SLP Panther Proud because Spring Lake Park Schools has offered me a lot of opportunities to get involved in activities and succeed. Also because there are a number of staff members who have mentored me and supported me in my years here at SLP."

article.a: Continue Reading about Class of 2020 - Simon Tewalt

div.title: The winners pose with the STEM prototype and project poster

img.alt: The winners pose with the STEM prototype and project poster

div.p: Lily Peterson and Lily Engelke, a team calling themselves Lily², have learned their ‘Octo the Octopus' prototype has been awarded third place in the Minnesota Zoo’s ZOOMS STEM Design Challenge.

article.a: Continue Reading about ‘Octo the Octopus' wins third place

div.title: Class of 2020 student Hannah Anderson smiling

img.alt: Class of 2020 student Hannah Anderson smiling

div.p: "Spring Lake Park Schools has prepared me for my future because I had the chance to get nationally certified as an EMT before my senior year. I was fortunate enough to work with real patients out in the field...This allowed me to get life experience outside of the classroom."

article.a: Continue Reading about Class of 2020 - Hannah Anderson

div.div: 1415 81st Avenue NE Spring Lake Park, MN 55432

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: Important Message: School year to conclude through extended flexible learning; Buildings remain closed

p.b: Governor Walz has ordered K-12 schools in Minnesota to remain closed through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. In addition, the Minnesota State High School League has canceled the spring athletic and fine arts season.

div.p: The school year will be completed through extended flexible learning. Meal services for children in our community and childcare for health care workers and first responders continues.
While this is not how we wanted to end the school year, we are focused on making the best of this situation and thankful for the support and partnership of our learning community.
Find a full update at SpringLakeParkSchools.org/Coronavirus
